pullRequest.title: [2.19.x] G-9380 Unable to Edit a Buffer for MGRS Point Radius Search
pullRequest.bodyText:
ddf-ui PRs:
3.4.x codice/ddf-ui#447

What does this PR do?
The user cannot manually enter numbers into the buffer field for MGRS Point Radius. User also cannot edit numbers that have been input into the MGRS Point Radius buffer that have been entered by drawing the geometry on the map.
Who is reviewing it?

@andrewzimmer
@hayleynorton
@cassandrabailey293
@zta6
@Lambeaux
Select relevant component teams:

Ask 2 committers to review/merge the PR and tag them here.

How should this be tested?

• build / run / profile install / upload sample data
Method 1

From any of these geometry field types (anyGeo, location, center), select Point Radius.
Select the MGRS coordinate format
Place cursor in Radius value box and enter a number from buffer radius
Ensure no error occurs and able to enter radius number

Method 2

From any of these geometry field types (anyGeo, location, center), select Point Radius.
Select the MGRS coordinate format
Click the Draw button and draw a Point Radius on the map. This will input numbers into the Radius buffer field.
Try to edit those numbers
Ensure no error occurs and able to edit radius number

Any background context you want to provide?
What are the relevant tickets?
Fixes: #____
Screenshots

Before

After

Checklist:

 Documentation Updated
 Update / Add Threat Dragon models
 Update / Add Unit Tests
 Update / Add Integration Tests

Notes on Review Process
Please see Notes on Review Process for further guidance on requirements for merging and abbreviated reviews.
Review Comment Legend:

✏️ (Pencil) This comment is a nitpick or style suggestion, no action required for approval. This comment should provide a suggestion either as an in line code snippet or a gist.
❓ (Question Mark) This comment is to gain a clearer understanding of design or code choices, clarification is required but action may not be necessary for approval.
❗ (Exclamation Mark) This comment is critical and requires clarification or action before approval.

commit.message: G-9380 Unable to Edit a Buffer for MGRS Point Radius Search

nodes.bodyText: huh, it looks like we set this error in the onBlur for all the other Radius components, but did it here for MGRS in the onChange. I don't think we had any reason to do it this way IIRC, @hayleynorton ?
